name: domprobmeas

stmt.origin: sylib(wcel(c0, cprb), wcel(c0, cfv(cmeas, cdm(c0))), wcel(c0, cuni(crn(cmeas))))
stmt.pretty: sylib(c0 ∈ Prob, c0 ∈(measures ` dom(c0)), c0 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cprb), wcel(c0, cfv(cmeas, cdm(c0))))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cprb), wcel(c0, cuni(crn(cmeas))))
-| wb(wcel(c0, cuni(crn(cmeas))), wcel(c0, cfv(cmeas, cdm(c0))))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Prob → c0 ∈(measures ` dom(c0)))
⊣ (c0 ∈ Prob → c0 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures))
⊣ (c0 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures)↔ c0 ∈(measures ` dom(c0)))

-| wb(wcel(c0, cuni(crn(cmeas))), wcel(c0, cfv(cmeas, cdm(c0))))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Prob → c0 ∈(measures ` dom(c0)))
⊣ (c0 ∈ Prob → c0 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures))
⊣ (c0 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures)↔ c0 ∈(measures ` dom(c0)))

stmt.origin: simplbi(wcel(c0, cprb), wcel(c0, cuni(crn(cmeas))), wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(cdm(c0))), nat1))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cprb), wcel(c0, cuni(crn(cmeas))))
-| wb(wcel(c0, cprb), wa(wcel(c0, cuni(crn(cmeas))), wceq(cfv(c0, cuni(cdm(c0))), nat1)))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Prob → c0 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures))
⊣ (c0 ∈ Prob ↔(c0 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures)∧(c0 ` ⋃ dom(c0))= 1))

cumulated.pretty:

⊣ (c0 ∈ Prob ↔(c0 ∈ ⋃ ran(measures)∧(c0 ` ⋃ dom(c0))= 1))

comment: A probability measure is a measure on its domain. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 23-Dec-2016.)
